greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Zero-based row index to irregular tables organized as successively larger square matrices.
comment: With sequences constructed of successively larger kxk square matrices (cf. A074279), a(n) will return the distance of n from the top edge of the matrix that n is located in, with 0 standing for the topmost row in that matrix (please see the Example section).
A237451 gives the corresponding column index.
A238013 and A121997 give these same row and column indices, but starting the numbering with index 1. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 17 2014
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of squares with sizes 1x1 .. 30x30, flattened
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 08 2014
